citeinfo.origin: National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Surface Marine Data

descript.abstract: Synoptic observations taken aboard ships of opportunity, research vessels, and navy ships. All standard surface meteorological elements are recorded. In addition, sea surface temperature, ice accretion, and wave direction/height are most often observed. The data set contains observations received from Global Telecommunications System (GTS) international exchange and ships logs. Observations usually taken at 4 main GMT synoptic hours but some 3-hourly intermediate observations also are included. Recent (1970's) adjunct data set contains permanent and drifting buoy data (TD-1132). Data consists of approximately 328 reels CCT at 6250 bpi and the bytes per record are variable.
descript.purpose: To create a data set containing observations received from Global Telecommunications System (GTS) international exchange and ships logs.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
